channel.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com

item.title: Team Update #8
item.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Section 3.3 FIRST Safety in section 3 “At the Events”, has been updated to include the text below:

Teams are not allowed to set up their own 802.11a/b/g/n (2.4GHz or 5GHz) wireless communication (access points or ad-hoc networks) in the venue.


Section 9 - The Tournament, has been updated to include the following:

Match results via Twitter:

At the completion of each match, the Field Management System will post the results of each match to Twitter. Information about how to follow the Twitter feed is posted on the FRC game manual website under Section 9 - The Tournament.

Section 10 - The Kit of Parts, has been updated to include the following:

FisherPrice pinion – tooth count:

It has come to our attention that some of the FisherPrice motors in the 2010 KOP shipped with 15 tooth pinions instead of the 19-tooth pinions that mate with the provided FisherPrice gearbox. If your team received 15-tooth pinions and needs the 19-tooth pinions, please contact FIRST to trade motors at frcparts@usfirst.org. We offer our apologies for the inconvenience.

To view the document in its entirety please click the link below:
Team Update 8.pdf

~The Robo-Sharks 1612

item.title: Week 5
item.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
This was a very successful week for us here. We have accomplished everything that was on our list for this week. And if that wasn’t enough we also sent off all of our frame material to go get welded. Things are really looking good as we head into the last week of the build season.

Today the Robo-Sharks participated in an amazing fundraiser event at our school called Shark-Aid. This event was to raise money and collect non perishable food items to help in the aid of Haiti. Who knew that smashing a pie in someone’s face could be so entertaining.

~The Robo-Sharks 1612

item.title: Week 4
item.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
So we have reached the end of the fourth week. There are no major updates for this week just a few minor tweaks that where completed on the robot. The programming team was working hard this week to complete the camera code and test a couple different autonomous situations.

This years robot is looking really good we cant wait to see all the teams at regionals this year.

~The Robo-Sharks 1612

item.title: Week 3
item.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Today we spent all day test our drive system and new control system. It was exciting to see how talented everyone is at driving this year. Here is a quick look at our system for this year, it may look a bit messy at first but it is quite organized if you take a second look.


~The Robo-Sharks 1612

item.title: Week 2
item.dc:creator: RoboSharks1612@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
This week was very exciting we have finish a few major tasks and the outcome is stunning. We have finished our drive system that we have created. We have developed axel block for our wheels that use gravity to adjust the tension of our chains. While they also tension our chains they also act as a type of suspension system for our robot. These amazing wheel mounts are a miracle and really amazing to see in action. If you are attending the florida regional be sure to stop by our pit and someone will be more then happy to show them to you. We are very proud of our innovative creations that do 2 jobs in one.

~The Robo-Sharks 1612
